saying— “chopping off the heads first and memorialize later", which means acting
first and reporting afterwards.?4 That was a serious accusation to Zhang, because a
very strict system of party discipline had been enforced on the basis of Liu Shaoqi's
political treatiseHow tobe a Good Communist before theCR.If onedisobeyed the
instructions from the superior, one could be labeled as"anti-party", or even as
“counter-revolutionary". Nonetheless, Mao lent his full support to Zhang and stated:
"'you can chop off their heads first and memorialize later.'35 Facts always come first,
then concepts." As clarified by Mao later, “If there are no facts, how could concepts
form? If there is no practice, where is theory? Sometimes theory and practice run
parallel, sometimes theory comes first, but practice is decisive and the most important
